Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with healthy green leaves, effectively showing it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with drooping or brown leaves to clearly show it doesn't have enough water.
The student can accurately include the sun in their drawing to represent the plant's need for light to grow.
The student can depict different kinds of animals that rely on plants for food, showing a clear understanding of interdependence.
The student can illustrate that plants need both water and light to live and grow, synthesizing all necessary elements into a cohesive drawing.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit labels for each element in their drawing or assume understanding without explanation *(assumes the observer can identify elements without labels)*.
The student might not show minor details like soil texture or specific plant species, focusing instead on key concepts *(focuses on main ideas rather than finer details)*.
